newsitem.title: GERMANY: Prosecutors to focus on banks, others in SAP probe.
newsitem.headline: Prosecutors to focus on banks, others in SAP probe.

text.p: German prosecutors said on Friday their inquiry into allegations of insider trading at software group SAP AG would now focus on banks and people with ties to the firm.
A spokesman for the Frankfurt prosecutors' office also said its probe within SAP itself could well be closed within a few weeks.
The prosecutors' spokesman said it was still not clear how many people outside SAP would form part of the new investigation.
He repeated, however, that there was no suspicion of primary insider dealing -- that is, by people with direct access to stock-sensitive information.

Insider-dealing has since 1994 been punishable in Germany with up to five years imprisonment, with primary insiders likely to receive stiffer penalties than those with more limited access to information.
